did.abstract: One document certifying Samuel Barger's 1814 honorable discharge from from Lt. Col. Jonathan Varian's Regiment Light Infantry of the State of New York.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Samuel Barger discharge, 1814, 1978.024, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

The document had evidently at one point ripped into several pieces and been repaired with adhesive tape. The tape was apparently later removed and the document mounted on black paper and covered with plastic which was attached with tape. The archivist removed the plastic and tape and sleeved the mounted document in mylar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One document certifying Samuel Barger's honorable discharge from the Encampment Headquarters in Brooklyn Heights as a private on November 28, 1814 from Lt. Col. Jonathan Varian's Regiment Light Infantry of the State of New York.
